ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He has not given birth and was not born.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He has begotten no one, and is begotten of none.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He neither begot any nor was He begotten,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He neither begets nor was He begotten.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “He has no offspring, nor is He born from anything.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He begets not, nor was He begotten."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He begets not, nor is He begotten.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: who has not begotten, and has not been begotten,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He begetteth not nor was begotten.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He does not give birth, nor was He born,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He begetteth not, nor Was He begotten.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He neither begat, nor was begotten,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He begetteth not, nor is He begotten;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He begets not, nor was He begotten;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Who has not given birth, and has not been born,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He begets not, nor was He begotten.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He neither begets nor is born,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [112:3] He neither begot, for no likeness of Him can exist, nor was begotten, since createdness is precluded in His case.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And it is also said that al-Samad means:(He begetteth not nor was begotten) He says: He did not inherit and will not be inherited; and it is also said this means: He does not have a son who will inherit His dominion and He was not begotten, which means that He did not inherit His dominion.
